title: Prohibited acts; penalties
context: §467E-13 Prohibited acts; penalties. (a) No person shall: (1) Use in connection with the person&rsquo;s name any designation tending to imply that the person is a social worker, licensed bachelor social worker, licensed social worker, or licensed clinical social worker unless the person is duly licensed and authorized under this chapter; (2) Represent oneself as a social worker, licensed bachelor social worker, licensed social worker, or licensed clinical social worker during the time the person&rsquo;s license issued under this chapter is forfeited, terminated, suspended, or revoked; (3) Perform clinical diagnosis or psychotherapy unless the person is a licensed clinical social worker; or (4) Engage in autonomous and independent clinical social work practice without being licensed as a licensed clinical social worker. (b) Any person who violates this section shall be subject to a fine of not more than $1,000 and each day&rsquo;s violation shall be deemed a separate offense. [L 1994, c 251, pt of §2; am L 2001, c 229, §§3, 5; am L 2002, c 16, §29 and c 167, §§15, 17]
